  • Constructor Details

    • MCTGate

      public MCTGate(int[] control) throws GateException
      Public constructor to initialize a MCT gate.

      It takes an integer array representing gate points. Then validates the parameter. If the parameter is valid only then it creates the object otherwise throws GateException

      Parameters:
      control - of the first gate
      Throws:
      GateException - thrown if the validation fails. Validation includes -
      • null check
      • input line check
      • compatibility check

  • Method Details

    • getOrder

      public int getOrder()
      Returns the number of input lines of the gate
      Returns:
      the number of input lines of the gate

    • getInputBuffer

      public boolean[] getInputBuffer()
      Returns the input buffer of the gate.

      It do not returns the actual buffer but a new array containing the value of the buffer.

      Returns:
      boolean array representing input buffer

    • getOutputBuffer

      public boolean[] getOutputBuffer()
      Returns the output buffer of the gate.

      It do not returns the actual buffer but a new array containing the value of the buffer.

      Returns:
      boolean array representing output buffer

    • getControl

      public GateControl[] getControl()
      Returns a array of GateControl

      Do not returns the actual array but returns a new copied array.

      Returns:
      GateControl array representing gate points

    • setInputBuffer

      public void setInputBuffer(boolean[] buffer) throws GateException
      Accepts a boolean array and loads the data to the input buffer of the gate.

      Do not set the passed array as the input buffer, rather copy the content to the buffer. Buffer is set only when the parameter is valid, otherwise throws GateException.

      Parameters:
      buffer - boolean array from which the values will be copied to the input buffer of the gate.
      Throws:
      GateException - thrown if the argument is null or the order of the gate and the order of the argument mismatch

    • setOutputBuffer

      public void setOutputBuffer(boolean[] buffer) throws GateException
      Accepts a boolean array and loads the data to the output buffer of the gate.

      Do not set the passed array as the output buffer, rather copy the content to the buffer. Buffer is set only when the parameter is valid, otherwise throws GateException.

      Parameters:
      buffer - boolean array from which the values will be copied to the output buffer of the gate.
      Throws:
      GateException - thrown if the argument is null or the order of the gate and the order of the argument mismatch

    • propagate

      public void propagate()
      Propagates the input through the gate and populates the output buffer with the output.

    • reversePropagate

      public void reversePropagate()
      Propagate in reverse order i.e. from output to input.

      Compute the input from the output.

    • clearBuffers

      public void clearBuffers()
      Clears the input and output buffer.

      Both the buffers are set to false after this operation.
